author: TravisEz13
body:
The code for the previous implementation is here:
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/tree/master/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.LocalAccounts 
removed due to #4272

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body:
Looks like https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/lmaccess/ APIs are now public. So we could port this to Core, just need to map the old API calls to public ones.
lmaccess.h header

comments.author: fullenw1
comments.body:
Any news on this module?
In PowerShell 7 it's still not working...

```powershell
PS> Get-LocalGroup
Get-LocalGroup: The 'Get-LocalGroup' command was found in the module 'Microsoft.PowerShell.LocalAccounts', but the module could not be loaded.
For more information, run 'Import-Module Microsoft.PowerShell.LocalAccounts'.

PS> Import-Module -Name Microsoft.PowerShell.LocalAccounts
Import-Module: The parameter is incorrect.

PS> Import-Module -Name Microsoft.PowerShell.LocalAccounts -UseWindowsPowerShell
Import-Module: The parameter is incorrect.

PS>
```

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT Do we still need this if it works.  Looks like it loads directly in PowerShell 7.

comments.author: fullenw1
comments.body:
Hi @TravisEz13 

Interesting! I upgraded PowerShell 7.0.0 to PowerShell 7.0.1 but still have the same error message.
There is certainly a difference between our systems...

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body:
If `Import-Module -Name Microsoft.PowerShell.LocalAccounts` isn't working, please file a different issue with repro steps. 

This is working fine on my machine (and has for a while). I agree with @TravisEz13 (and @SteveL-MSFT offline), that this isn't something we need to do for Windows specifically given that it already ships in the box and is fully compatible.

title: Implement LocalAccounts module using supported APIs
